name: 女性文學、性別平等理論與婦運
comment: Students should be able to read journal articles written in English and write an essay in English. Learn how to use Microsoft Teams and Moodle. Include your name, your student number, course title, and class B in all correspondence.
goals: Become familiar with major concepts and theories, and with key issues in correlating literature.
Develop the ability to think independently.
Develop interpretive and critical reading and writing skills.
syllabus:
16+2 weeks         

      **Please wear a medical or surgical mask in the classroom. Learn how to use Microsoft Teams and Moodle. Students should be able to read journal articles written in English and write an essay in English.** Include your name, your student number, course title, and class B in all correspondence.

Week 1 Introduction, global feminism, third wave and fourth wave Western feminisms, and the women’s movement

Week 2 Zines; current concerns

Week 3 Graham; research resources

Week 4 Spivak

Week 5 Showalter

Week 6 Gender violence

Week 7 Ku

Week 8 The women’s movement in Taiwan; CEDAW

Week 9 Feminist film theories

Week 10 Hsia Yu

Week 11 Yen; Taiwanese women’s literature and theories

Week 12 Chang; Chow

Week 13 Shu Ting; Chinese women’s literature and theories

Week 14 Asian American feminism and women’s poetry

Week 15 Exam

Week 16 Pai

Week 17 Styles (Moodle)

Week 18 Other women writers, feminist theories, and issues of the women’s movement (Moodle)

methodologies.note: An oral presentation, a current concerns post, and current concerns discussion
Moodle, Microsoft Teams, an oral presentation, a midterm essay, a midterm paper, an exam, and library workshop
An oral presentation, a midterm essay, and a midterm paper

grading.note: A take-home exam, a midterm essay, or a midterm paper

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
